programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: Near the end of the Gulf War, soldiers use a map that may lead them to gold that Saddam Hussein stole from Kuwait.

programme.title: Burglar
programme.desc: A San Francisco cat burglar (Whoopi Goldberg) is blamed for a murder she sees during a jewel heist she must make.

programme.title: Moving
programme.desc: A yuppie (Richard Pryor) loses his job in New Jersey and moves his wife (Beverly Todd) and family to Boise, Idaho.

programme.title: The Jackie Robinson Story
programme.desc: After a successful baseball career in college and as a coach in the military, Jackie Robinson attracts the attention of Major League Baseball's Branch Rickey.

programme.title: Bright Road
programme.desc: A Southern schoolteacher (Dorothy Dandridge) pays special attention to her most rebellious fourth-grader (Philip Hepburn).

programme.title: A Patch of Blue
programme.desc: A blind white teenager (Elizabeth Hartman), sheltered by her sleazy mother (Shelley Winters), falls in love with a kind young black man (Sidney Poitier).

programme.title: Boot Hill
programme.desc: A scruffy gunfighter (Terence Hill) and his king-size sidekick (Bud Spencer) take on bad guys in the Old West.

programme.title: Putney Swope
programme.desc: A token employee (Arnold Johnson) on Madison Avenue becomes his agency's president and makes some changes.

programme.title: The Next Dance
programme.desc: Selena and Tristian grow up together and follow different career paths. Selena lives to dance, and Tristian works for his father's accounting firm. When a dance competition with a $100,000 prize is announced, the two team up to beat Selena's rival.

programme.title: The Internship Games
programme.desc: Six students from different colleges are too busy competing for an internship with Econo Air to notice the chaos going on around them.

programme.title: The American Dream
programme.desc: Two college football players struggle to avoid temptation and keep themselves on the right path.

programme.title: Pride & Prejudice: Atlanta
programme.desc: The author of a self-help book on how to find the perfect husband is determined to find eligible mates for her five single daughters.

programme.title: Round Midnight
programme.desc: A jazz saxophonist (Dexter Gordon) from New York has a friend (Fran√ßois Cluzet) on the Left Bank of 1959 Paris.

programme.title: Under the Cherry Moon
programme.desc: News of a trust-fund beauty (Kristin Scott Thomas) inspires the pianist (Prince) at a hotel in Nice on the Riviera.
